description: This is a course in the writing of short prose forms, often called “flash fiction” and “flash nonfiction,” entailing the writing of brief prose pieces of fewer than fifteen hundred words.  Students will read models of flash prose and create both in-class and out-of-class examples of the form on a frequent basis.
title: Flash: Short Prose Writing
prerequisite: A writing sample submitted to the instructor before the start of the semester to ascertain writing ability and eligibility for the course.
